ygData.subject: Re: Freeport Bank Crowding Secret was: Bard Petition
ygData.msgSnippet: Ack in all truth this situation is not one of those between a rock and a hard place situations.  Killing him does indeed make you faction with the Freeport
ygData.messageBody:
Ack in all truth this situation is not one of those between a rock and a
hard place situations. Killing him does indeed make you faction with the
Freeport Militia bad and yes you can be KOS, but there is an easy way for
you to raise your faction with the people and militia of Freeport. My
friend was KOS for killing him in hopes of completing the Paladin Quest,
he is not apprehensive. I also know of Trolls that are amiable in the
city. I included the spoiler at the end of this quoted block if you
really need to know.

On Wed, 4 Aug 1999, John Kim wrote:

> From: John Kim <kim@...>
>
> Arrgh, rock and hard place. The spoiler below may be vital to
> any bard's ability to freely travel in Freeport. If you
> regularly group with paladins, I suggest you go ahead and read
> it, as the spoiler is minor, but the grief it can save you is
> immense.
>
> On Wed, 4 Aug 1999, Scott Thompson wrote:
> >
> > **SPOILER***
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > .
> > Ok, so curiosity got the better of you I see 8)
> > Here is the story- there is a guard that spawns
> > in the bank named Krazen Loosh. The people are
> > all camping there waiting for him to spawn so
> > they can kill him. Apparently, the other guards
> > do not assist him. There is a minor faction hit
> > associated with killing Krazen but I have seen
> > people camp for a week without becoming KOS.
>
> Beware, this will make you KOS to the Freeport Militia. They
> are the guards in West and East Freeport. The guards in North
> Freeport are all paladins (except Krazen) which is why you do
> not become KOS to them. This is actually part of a bigger
> plot, in which the paladins and the militia are both fighting
> for control of Freeport. Nearly anything that raises your
> faction with the paladins lowers it with the militia, and vice
> versa.

Actually there is one way to raise your faction with the Freeport Militia
without harming you faction with the paladins. If you go into the tunnels
beneath Freeport you will bump into a human standing beside a a dwarf.
When you talk to the dwarf he will mention how much he misses Kaladim. To
alleviate his homesickness you give his human friend some dwarven ale and
bang you improve your faction with the Freeport Militia. BTW if the
Freeport Militia hate you, the people of Freeport will hate you also.
Except in North Freeport since the Paladins run that area.


Treilanin Loreweaver
Honour Guard, Karana
